name: Anagathic
description: Drugs which counteract the aging process. Supposedly, a regimen of regular monthly doses enables an individual to ignore the debilitating effects of advancing years. Because of the rarity and demand for anagathics, they are quite expensive and are often unavailable at any price.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Antibiotic
description: Daily (or QPR) antidote drugs which counteracts a specific targeted effect according to type. Examples include a toxin, suffocation, the onset of a sickness or deprivation, Fast Drug and Slow Drug, anti-rejection, anti-septic, etc.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Antidote
description: Daily (or QPR) antidote drugs which counteracts a specific targeted effect according to type. Examples include a toxin, suffocation, the onset of a sickness or deprivation, Fast Drug and Slow Drug, anti-rejection, anti-septic, etc.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Bandage
description: Light wound dressing. At higher technology levels, bandages include contact medicines to mitigate injury, improve healing, and prevent local bacterial infection

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Cast
description: Limb Immobilizer. Acts as a Bandage for the purpose of mending broken bones, exoskeleton, or the like. TL3 and earlier versions are called splints (for legs) and slings (for arms) and can be applied in the field.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Combat Drug SE
description: This variant of the combat drug increases personal strength and endurance. The effect begins 30 seconds after being taken and lasts for about 10 minutes.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Combat Drug SS
description: This drug increases personal strength and stamina. The effect begins 30 seconds after being taken and lasts for about 10 minutes.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Combat Drug SV
description: This drug increases personal strength and vigor. The effect begins 30 seconds after being taken and lasts for about 10 minutes.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Counteract
description: Daily (or QPR) antidote drugs which counteracts a specific targeted effect according to type. Examples include a toxin, suffocation, the onset of a sickness or deprivation, Fast Drug and Slow Drug, anti-rejection, anti-septic, etc.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Fast Drug
description: So named because it makes the universe appear, to its user, to move much more quickly. The drug slows down personal metabolism at a ratio of approximately 60 to 1. Users are extremely vulnerable while living at such a slow rate, but physical aging is also slowed, and the need for consumable supplies is reduced which thus allows con- servation of air and food. Fast drug takes effect immediately upon ingestion, one dose lasts for 60 days, making that time appear to be only one day.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: First Aid Kit
description: Modern medical tools containing drugs, resuscitation equipment, surgical supplies, and diagnostic materials. The kit is sufficient for both minor and serious wounds, and it can be used for the treatment of animal injuries, radiation burns, chemical burns, poisoning, and drug overdoses. TL 9+ versions include Skin Glue, which stops surface wounds and accelerates the healing process better than antibiotics and bandages.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Limb Reattacher
description: Heals severe wounds or trauma on a limb. Reattaches severed limbs, encourages mending and removes infection. Treatment induces an artificial coma for 1D days, and injects the patient with a cocktail of tailored regrowth drugs and nutrients (one dose per treatment).

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Low Berth
description: A berth for carrying one person in low passage; typically installed in a ship. Low berths also serve well in emergencies in that they can provide suspended animation facilities for characters when medical care or rescue is not immediately available. Displaces 0.5 tons.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Low Berth, Capsule
description: A berth for carrying one person in low passage; typically installed in a ship. Low berths also serve well in emergencies in that they can provide suspended animation facilities for characters when medical care or rescue is not immediately available. Displaces 1.0 tons.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Low Berth, Emergency
description: A berth used for survival emergencies when medical care or rescue is not immediately available. Each emergency low berth holds four persons who share the same revival task roll. Displaces 1.0 tons.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Medical Capsule
description: The medical capsule has a diagnostic computer, a variety of therapeutic medicines, and a database of medical procedures. Acts as a Doctor with C+S=TL. Aside from the standard Medical and Capsule modifications, also treats severe wounds or trauma; repairs, reattaches, or, if necessary, regrows a damaged or destroyed organ or limb, as a Doctor with C+S=TL. Each treatment puts the patient into suspended animation for 1D x 10 weeks, and injects the patient with tailored regrowth drugs and nutrients costing KCr100 (one dose per treatment).

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Low Berth, Military
description: A berth for carrying two persons in low passage; typically installed in a ship. The military low berth keeps reserve troops (Frozen Guard) in storage until needed. Displaces 1.0 tons.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Low Berth, Stasis
description: A berth for carrying one person in low passage in a stasis field; typically installed in a ship. Low berths also serve well in emergencies in that they can provide suspended animation facilities for characters when medical care or rescue is not immediately available. Displaces 0.5 tons. Offline power lasts for years.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Medical Scanner
description: This larger, handheld version of the micro med scanner. This version of the medical scanner differs from the pocket version in that this model includes a diagnosis computer, which allows individuals with little or no medical skill to diagnose and treat illness and injury.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Medical Kit
description:
Modern medical tools containing drugs, resuscitation equipment, surgical supplies, and diagnostic materials. The kit is sufficient for both minor and serious wounds, and it can be used for the treatment of animal injuries, radiation burns, chemical burns, poisoning, and drug overdoses. TL 9+ versions include Skin Glue, which stops surface wounds and accelerates the healing process better than antibiotics and bandages.

All TL9+ medical kits come with a size 2 pocket (micro) med scanner.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Nutrient
description: Basic nutritional replacement for a single meal. The nutrient is stored in a disposable container as a slurry of protein, carbohydrate, and fats in a cocktail of vitamins and glucose. Quality is low. High quality versions, with better flavor or more desirable ingredient origins, cost more.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Painkiller
description: Masks damage caused by injury from the patient for 1D hours. The damage is still there, but the patient can perform tasks as if damage were 0. When the painkiller wears off, the patient's internal clock advances to its "rest" period, and suffers fatigue until appropriate rest is taken.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Panacea
description: Cures most known pathogenic illnesses and accelerates the body's healing process. Patient is fully recovered in one week's time.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Psi Booster
description: Adds 1D to the user's Psi rating for 1D hours. The basic psi-drug, booster is available in small one-dose pills. Booster increases an individual's available psionic strength. Additional doses have no effect if taken by a psionic within an hour. The drug-induced additional psionic strength will wane and disappear at the end of one hour.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Psi Double
description: Doubles Psi for 1D hours. A more potent form of the psi-drug, also available in small one-dose pills. Double increases psionic power by about double.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Psi Special
description: Increases Psi by 1 point per hour to a maximum of 15. After 4 hours at 15, the effect wanes by 1 point per hour until Psi reaches 0. The rarest of psidrugs, special is available only in liquid form and must be taken by injection.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Restorative
description: Returns the patient to its full original SAN.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Sensory Drugs
description:
Drugs which enhance an existing sense constant by +Flux for 1D hours. Multiple doses provide additive effects, but does not extend duration.

Available enhancement types:

  • Awareness
  • Hearing
  • Olfactory
  • Perception
  • Tactile
  • Vision
  • Vision Spectrum

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Skin Glue
description: Stops surface wounds and accelerates the healing process better than antibiotics and bandages. Ten doses.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Sling
description: Limb Immobilizer. Acts as a Bandage for the purpose of mending broken bones, exoskeleton, or the like.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Slow Drug
description:
So named because it makes the universe (from the user's viewpoint) appear to move more slowly. The drug achieves the effect by accelerating the user's metabolism. In effect, the user lives approximately twice as fast as normal.

Slow drug takes effect 45 seconds after ingestion and continues to function for about 10 minutes. At the end of its effect, the user receives 1D in wounds. The person is extremely fatigued, is treated as if all available combat swings have been taken, and must recover from that fatigue. A person under slow drug (because he or she is living at twice the normal rate) can make twice as many actions or move twice as far as normal.

Medical Slow Drug causes unconsciousness and the passage of thirty days equivalent recovery time in one day. During this period, ordinary healing takes place. No wounds are received from the use of medical slow drug, but the individual is unconscious or semi-conscious while under its influence.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Splint
description: Limb Immobilizer. Acts as a Bandage for the purpose of mending broken bones, exoskeleton, or the like.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Stasis Capsule, Military
description: A berth for carrying one or two individuals in stasis for (typically) up to 90 years off-line, or indefinitely when connected to a reliable power source.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Tranq
description: Renders patient unconscious for 1D hours.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Truth Drug
description: Used to compel individuals to answer interrogation truthfully. One dose is sufficient to assure truthful answers for approximately two minutes, after which the user experiences one hour of unconsciousness, and suffers 2D in wounds.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Vaccine
description: Prevents illness. If administered once per year, a vaccine can reduce both the chance of contracting a disease and the severity of any disease caught. Protects the patient from a family of similar diseases on the world where they occur.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures

name: Wound Dressing
description: Light wound dressing At higher technology levels the dressings also have contact medicines to mitigate injury, improve healing, and prevent local bacterial infection

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures
